dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 808 IH: Fairness for the Trades Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Perez (for herself and Mr. Edwards) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permit qualified business trade expenses to be treated as qualified higher education expenses for purposes of 529 accounts.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fairness for the Trades Act.

section.header: Qualified business trade expenses treated as qualified higher education expenses for purposes of 529 accounts

subsection.text: Section 529(e)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: The term qualified higher education expenses includes qualified business trade expenses (as defined in subsection (f)).

subsection.text: Section 529 is amended by redesignating subsection (f) as subsection (g) and by inserting after subsection (e) the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: The term qualified post business trade expenses means amounts paid by the designated beneficiary for specified business property used by the designated beneficiary in a qualified trade field.
The term specified business property means tangible property (other than buildings) which is of a character subject to the allowance for depreciation.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to expenses paid in taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
